thread.title: Ban ‘no threat’ to Promontory’s high ground over RBS inquiry
thread.title_full: Ban ‘no threat’ to Promontory’s high ground over RBS inquiry

title: Ban ‘no threat’ to Promontory’s high ground over RBS inquiry
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Ban ‘no threat’ to Promontory’s high ground over RBS inquiry The New York State department of ­financial services has accused Promontory of show a “lack of independent judgment” Spencer Platt/Getty Images Google+ 1 of 1 The New York State department of ­financial services has accused Promontory of show a “lack of independent judgment” Spencer Platt/Getty Images James Hurley Enterprise Editor Published at 12:01AM, August 5 2015 
Promontory Financial Group’s role in producing a long-awaited report into Royal Bank of Scotland’s treatment of small businesses is not under threat, the Financial Conduct Authority has said, despite the consulting firm being banned by an American regulator. 
Promontory has been suspended by the New York State department of financial services amid allegations that it “toned down” a report it filed to regulators regarding sanctions violations by Standard Chartered. 
On Monday the department accused it of showing a “lack of independent judgment” when it wrote a report into claims that Standard Chartered had helped its clients to bypass American sanctions Subscribe now 
To see the full article you need to subscribe Subscribe
